page.title: 01Introduction - South Swanage
page.content: This area includes part of the south east coast of Dorset, within the area known as the Isle of Purbeck. It is due south of the small resort town of Swanage. Geologically, it is formed from limestones of the Purbeck Series and provides an undulating landscape; with typical downland features. There is no stream or watercourse within the area. The vegetation is consistent with chalkland scenery. It includes grasslands, shrubs, and a multitude of wild plants, many of which are rare. Much of the area is farmland. There is also a considerable segment which is a Country Park and this includes part of the South West Heritage coastline.
